post.body: How's this for a blues tune: "If I Didn't Have Lucky Charms (I'd Have no Charm at All)"
There's no time like the present to watch Hitchcock's "Notorious." And here's your starter kit: http://bit.ly/11erp
If my email inbox is any indication, "Notorious" may be the current favorite among Hitchcock fans!
"Stolen Moments." Yeah. There was no fakery with Freddie Hubbard. He was the real deal.
Hey there - Thanks for the kind words! NOw. Back to "Dial M for Murder"
See what the Twittersphere has to say about Hitchcock's "Notorious" http://bit.ly/Bk1z
Griffith was the 1st to exploit the possibilities of the physical chase, but I tend to multiple chases and a lot of psychology. -A Hitchcock
"It's a Wonderful Life" was targeted by Hoover's FBI as an example of Communist propaganda: http://bit.ly/rp9y
I believe the definitive Twitter rating system has yet to be developed. Read this -- and my comments at the bottom: http://bit.ly/S2AX
RIP Freddie Hubbard. His "Red Clay" has been a part of my bands' set lists for a long time. He was a gift to the world. (Thx @CarriBugbee)
I'm still not sure what twinfluence is, but I guess I have some.
12/29/08 http://twinfluence.com score for JoelGunz: Reach=646,101, Rank=#4,429
Nut bandits steal $100,000 in cashews http://is.gd/e5mH. Failing to take a bite out of crime, cops find this case hard to crack.
I couldn't resist retweeting this: @weirdnews The Ultimate Fart Silencer http://is.gd/e41L
Even William Kristol is looking forward to Inauguration Day. Now THAT's an audacious hope. http://bit.ly/XSOe
Back at work. Plowing through huge embankments of accumulated emai. I feel as if I should put snow tires on my Firefox browser window.
...and his muscular body went limp in her arms, she saw the future melt away like the warm trailing days after a brilliant snowfall.
They campaigned to shake the fruit from the sturdy trees of the oligarchy - a bid both popular and insane. So when the shot hit its target-
A very short story in two tweets: “Alas, Only in Due Time,” by yours truly.
RT @tlynnm: Goodbye Eartha Kitt... Your talent, wit & great gams were cherished and appreciated by many.
